intro: Ipomoea poilanei, commonly known as the Poliane morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is known for its rapid growth and ornamental value. Due to its invasive potential, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
